info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 12:19AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, Mitchell, Avery, north central Buncombe and Yancey Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1219 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Sugar Grove to 11 miles northwest of Marshall. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burnsville, Newland, Marshall, Spruce Pine, Mars Hill, Banner Elk, Hot Springs, Elk Park, Bakersville and Beech Mountain In Avery County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for western North Carolina.
